intro: Ayapanopsis tarapotensis, commonly known as the Tarapotense Ayapanopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or humid habitats. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are often yellow or greenish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
